I like Edge as name for this as long as we are explicit in the comments, and consistent with the names of fields:

// An edge (func, index) represents the index-th input of `func`
// Functions contain a list `output_edges` the same length as the number of outputs it produces which connects output to a particular input of another function.
// In this representation a particular function input (func, index) may have multiple incoming edges, which are implicitly summed before passing the value to func.

I think we should avoid using output_nr in Edge because the offset is the index into the input list of the function. output_nr can also be confusing in Variables, because depending on how the actual gradient Functions were produced, it doesn't actually correspond to the position in the output list a Variable was in (e.g. if a single forward produced 2 separate backward Functions for its two inputs).
